etymology.description: 火(火) (huǒ, "fire") refers to the use of heat or flame, and 鍋(鍋) (guō, "pot") is a cooking vessel. The combination 火鍋(鍋) (huǒguō, "hot pot") refers to a pot in which ingredients are cooked at the table in a simmering broth.
etymology.interpretation: A 火鍋(鍋) (huǒguō, "hot pot") is a communal dish where ingredients are cooked at the table in a pot of simmering broth, representing both cooking and eating as a social activity. This practice is prevalent in Chinese culture, especially in colder regions or during social gatherings.

examples.chinese: 我们晚上去吃火锅(我們晚上去吃火鍋)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen wǎnshàng qù chī huǒ guō.
examples.english: We are going to have hot pot tonight.

examples.chinese: 家人团聚时(家人團聚時)，大家围坐一起涮火锅(大家圍坐一起涮火鍋)。
examples.pinyin: Jiārén tuánjù shí, dàjiā wéizuò yīqǐ shuàn huǒ guō.
examples.english: When the family gathers, everyone sits around and enjoys hot pot.

examples.chinese: 冬天寒冷时(冬天寒冷時)，一锅热腾腾的火锅能驱走寒意(一鍋熱騰騰的火鍋能驅走寒意)。
examples.pinyin: Dōngtiān hánlěng shí, yī guō rè téngténg de huǒ guō néng qūzǒu hányì.
examples.english: In the cold winter, a steaming hot pot can ward off the chill.
